alert.note: Alert for Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 9:15AM PST until January 11 at 6:45AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in California... Bear Creek above Mckee Road affecting Merced -Madera -Mendota and Planada -Le Grand -Snelling zones. .A strong storm system will bring a period of moderate to heavy rainfall to the central portion of the San Joaquin Valley and Sierra foothills on Monday and Tuesday. This will result in rapid runoff into the Merced River basin. For the Bear Creek...including Mckee Road...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Bear Creek above Mckee Road. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PST Sunday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM PST.

area.areaDesc: Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling
